statements.statement: I have sufficient language knowledge to teach senior levels.
Being able to speak fluently with native speakers is important to me.
Students often think language classes are unimportant.
Classroom management is an important part of language teaching.
Students have lower expectations of teachers who are non-native speakers.
I have reflected on how to teach about culture in my language classes.
I am confident to teach my TL in a classroom.
I use my TL in a variety of social contexts.
External language assessments/exams should be used to check a teacher's TL proficiency.
My primary/high school language teachers seemed to be engaged in improving their language teaching.
Parents regard non-native speakers as inferior to native speakers.
Teaching about cultural aspects is very motivating for students.
My language teacher identity is strongly influenced by my language learning experiences.
I feel confident about using my TL in a variety of social contexts
I am highly motivated to continually develop my knowledge of my TL.
Schools are not the best place to learn languages.
It's difficult to understand the culture embedded in a language if it's not your L1.
Maintaining networks for me to use the language regularly is important.
Building good relationships with students is the most important thing for a language teacher to teach effectively.
I feel confident about using my TL in a variety of formal contexts
All students can become successful language users.
Classroom management is harder for teachers who are non-native English speakers.
I am confident about integrating language and culture in my teaching.
Being multilingual is a strong marker of my identity.
I would feel comfortable using the TL anywhere in a school (e.g. staffroom, staff dining area) with other native/non-native speakers.
Language teaching will be a rewarding career.
Reflecting on my actions as a language teacher is a high priority for me
Native-like pronunciation is the best model for students.
It's sufficient for students to just learn about the mainstream culture linked to my TL.
Using the TL in regular classroom interactions will feel natural to me.
Using English is the most effective way to manage the classroom.
Most of my primary/high school language teachers were good at teaching.
Learning about culture is optional in language learning.
Language teachers are respected in schools.
My identity changes when I am using an L2.
I need to spend more time developing my TL proficiency.
External language assessments/exams should be used to check a teacher's knowledge of the TL grammar.
I need to spend more time developing my knowledge of TL grammar.
